title.narrative: Access and Benefit Sharing of Genetic Resources

description.narrative: Developing and Implementing the National Framework on Access and Benefit Sharing of Genetic Resources and Associated Traditional Knowledge
seat of a second-order administrative division

activity-description.narrative: This activity takes place in Xiangxi, Xishuangbanna, Guilin and Fangchenggang
This activity takes place in Xiangxi, Xishuangbanna, Guilin and Fangchenggang
This activity takes place in Xiangxi, Xishuangbanna, Guilin and Fangchenggang.

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).

description.narrative: 1.1.1: Organize the Inception meeting and the 1st meeting of Project Steering Committee (PSC) 1.1.2: Organize the 2nd meeting of Project Steering Committee (PSC) 1.1.3: Research on international ABS focuses and national experience of foreign countries and ABS case studies 1.1.4: Case studies on foreign bio-prospecting in China 1.1.5:National field survey, international study tour on ABS and participation in international workshop and conference on ABS 1.1.6: Organize Consulting and Reviewing meetings for all research activities under the outcome 1, and participation relevant workshops 1.1.7 Communications between various stakeholders 1.1.8 Report printing 1.1.9 Research on preparation for the Nagoya Protocol National Implementation Program 1.4.1: Research on ABS clearing-house mechanism 2.1.1 Public awareness raising material preparation, and training organizing consultant 2.1.2 public awareness raising activities, and participation relevant workshops 3.3.2 Application case procedures in pilots of Yunnan, Guangxi and Hunan Province, including the negotiation, agreements, contracts, governmental approval, contract implementation, compliance, monitoring, etc. 3.4.2 Disseminate materials of experience of the pilots in international conferences, including organize side events in COP-14 (2018) and (COP-15, 2020) for publicity of the project's experience on demonstration internationally.

comment.narrative: 1. Insufficient Legal and institutional settings for ABS implementation. 2. Insufficient stakeholder awareness and capacity to develop and implement national and local ABS norms 3. Limited capacity to regulate, oversee, promote and control bioprospecting and negotiation of viable ABS mechanisms

TYWP not updated yet (Feb. 2021) Output 1.1 State Council of China is provided with information needed to formally approve accession to the Nagoya Protocol and provide support to the National Implementation Program for Nagoya Protocol Output 1.2: National ABS framework—including, if and as appropriate, NP compliant PIC and community protocols, model contracts, codes of conduct and certificates of compliance/origin on ABS—developed with stakeholder participation and in compliance with Nagoya Protocol Output 1.3: ABS framework implementation plans formulated and operational, including: (i) plan for access to and benefit sharing of genetic resources and derivatives for commercial purposes; (ii) plan for access to genetic resources, traditional knowledge associated with genetic resources used for commercial purposes including application of PIC and community protocol, and benefit-sharing with regard to their utilization; and (iii) plan for academic/non-commercial research protocol Output 1.4: Establish national-level institutional arrangements for ABS Oupput 1.5:Proposals and guidelines for financial mechanisms related to benefit sharing, etc. Output 2.1: Enhanced capacity and awareness of implementation of China’s ABS regime at the national and provincial levels. Output 2.2: Training materials and programme for ABS Output 2.3: A platform to enable the sharing of technology and knowledge resources with Chinese stakeholders, including through the ABS Clearing-House Output 2.4: Systems and guidelines for sharing information and knowledge related to ABS among ministries Output 3.1:Enhanced understanding of genetic resources and associated traditional knowledge, related ABS opportunities and associated barriers in Hunan and Yunnan Provinces and Guangxi Autonomous Region
Output 3.2: Create the legal foundation for institutional arrangements and procedures that will govern ABS in the pilot areas
Output 3.3: ABS agreements negotiated and implemented across Hunan and Yunnan Provinces and Guangxi Autonomous Region (including examples from medicine, healthcare and others) in the pilot-demonstration jurisdictions Output 3.4 Lessons and experiences in implementing local ABS regimes are documented and disseminated for replication, based on the project’s replication plan

1. PMO has signed three contracts for formulating ABS Codes of Conduct (COC) for respectively three sectors as follows: 1) Academic Institute, 2) Chinese Traditional Medicine, and 3) Agriculture 2. The final report provides in-depth analysis of ABS information sharing system from aspects like the International Law of ABS information and International Cases of ABS Information Exchange. 3. The shooting of ABS project video began in 2020 and a demo was submitted for review. Now PMO is waiting for feedback from FECO management level and hope to complete the final version as soon as possible. 4. The GEF ABS Program was showcased at the exhibition of COP15 Phase I. And the information about project background, key activities and achievements was introduced. 5. Activities like awareness raising activities and knowledge sharing were held in Hainan, Yunnan Provinces and Guangxi Autonomous Region 6. The reports related to Digital Information and Big Data have been submitted, contributing to negotiation and create the legal foundation for institutional arrangements and procedures and other aspects. 7. A series of training sessions have been organized for community members, research institutes staffs as well as administrators.

Output 1.1 State Council of China is provided with information needed to formally approve accession to the Nagoya Protocol and provide support to the National Implementation Program for Nagoya Protocol Output 1.2: National ABS framework—including, if and as appropriate, NP compliant PIC and community protocols, model contracts, codes of conduct and certificates of compliance/origin on ABS—developed with stakeholder participation and in compliance with Nagoya Protocol Output 1.3: ABS framework implementation plans formulated and operational, including: (i) plan for access to and benefit sharing of genetic resources and derivatives for commercial purposes; (ii) plan for access to genetic resources, traditional knowledge associated with genetic resources used for commercial purposes including application of PIC and community protocol, and benefit-sharing with regard to their utilization; and (iii) plan for academic/non-commercial research protocol Output 1.4: Establish national-level institutional arrangements for ABS Oupput 1.5:Proposals and guidelines for financial mechanisms related to benefit sharing, etc. Output 2.1: Enhanced capacity and awareness of implementation of China’s ABS regime at the national and provincial levels. Output 2.2: Training materials and programme for ABS Output 2.3: A platform to enable the sharing of technology and knowledge resources with Chinese stakeholders, including through the ABS Clearing-House Output 2.4: Systems and guidelines for sharing information and knowledge related to ABS among ministries Output 3.1:Enhanced understanding of genetic resources and associated traditional knowledge, related ABS opportunities and associated barriers in Hunan and Yunnan Provinces and Guangxi Autonomous Region
Output 3.2: Create the legal foundation for institutional arrangements and procedures that will govern ABS in the pilot areas
Output 3.3: ABS agreements negotiated and implemented across Hunan and Yunnan Provinces and Guangxi Autonomous Region (including examples from medicine, healthcare and others) in the pilot-demonstration jurisdictions
Output 3.4 Lessons and experiences in implementing local ABS regimes are documented and disseminated for replication, based on the project’s replication plan

The 6th PSC meeting was held on Oct.22, 2020 in Xishuangbanna Yunnan with all members’ presence. Progress reports submitted by PMOs of National and Piloting sites were reviewed by the PSC. The committee examined every indicator and corresponding deliverables and agreed that the progress over past year is creditable.
In 2020, 21 themed meetings involving internal and external experts’ participation for discussing the challenges of perfecting articles of the Regulation on Management of ABS which canvassed in 2017 were organized by National PMO.
The research contract with Golden Bee Management Consulting Co., Ltd. was signed in April for studying the Applicability of China ABS Regulatory Framework. The implementation plan and mid-term? report were submitted in May and December respectively. The final report is to be submitted in the first quarter of 2021 based on the comments given by review panels.
The Study on important issues and countermeasures of microbial genetic resources access and benefit sharing (contract with Research Fellow Dr. Wu Jianyong) has been proceeding. The PMO had given comments in detail for reports submitted. Further revision is needed and the final report is expecting to be done by March 2021.
Research on Legitimacy and Compliance of Foreign Trade and Policy related ABS Management had launched in July. The contractor, University of International Business and Economics, has made comprehensive study with PMO supports. All final deliverables of the task are under review and final payment will be installed in the first quarter of 2021. This report particularly studied the conformity of the draft Regulation on ABS (2019) to WTO law and other domestic laws that regulate the access and utilization of genetic resources.

Output 1.1 State Council of China is provided with information needed to formally approve accession to the Nagoya Protocol and provide support to the National Implementation Program for Nagoya Protocol Output 1.2: National ABS framework—including, if and as appropriate, NP compliant PIC and community protocols, model contracts, codes of conduct and certificates of compliance/origin on ABS—developed with stakeholder participation and in compliance with Nagoya Protocol Output 1.3: ABS framework implementation plans formulated and operational, including: (i) plan for access to and benefit sharing of genetic resources and derivatives for commercial purposes; (ii) plan for access to genetic resources, traditional knowledge associated with genetic resources used for commercial purposes including application of PIC and community protocol, and benefit-sharing with regard to their utilization; and (iii) plan for academic/non-commercial research protocol (indicators:Guidance for adoption of relevant sub-national legislation; implemetation plan outlines) Output 1.4: Establish national-level institutional arrangements for ABS Output 2.1: Enhanced capacity and awareness of implementation of China’s ABS regime at the national and provincial levels (indicators: national and provincial level institutional capacity for ABS implementation, including awareness raising, survey, increased) Output 2.2: Training materials and programme for ABS Output 2.3: A platform to enable the sharing of technology and knowledge resources with Chinese stakeholders, including through the ABS Clearing-House Output 3.1:Enhanced understanding of genetic resources and associated traditional knowledge, related ABS opportunities and associated barriers in Hunan and Yunnan Provinces and Guangxi Autonomous Region Output 3.2: Create the legal foundation for institutional arrangements and procedures that will govern ABS in the pilot areas Output 3.3: ABS agreements negotiated and implemented across Hunan and Yunnan Provinces and Guangxi Autonomous Region (including examples from medicine, healthcare and others) in the pilot-demonstration jurisdictions Output 3.4 Lessons and experiences in implementing local ABS regimes are documented and disseminated for replication, based on the project’s replication plan

The project execution rate was lower than planned due to restructuring the PMO of which pervious members were transferred to prepare CBD COP 15. Yet some achievements gained. The 2019 PIR received High Satisfactory rating.
Two PSC meetings were held in 2019, and 2020-2021 TYWP was discussed and approved. Giving consideration to the project execution rate the 5th PSC meeting grant the approval to PMO to apply for project extension for 12 months. A new PM and a CTA were recruited. Study on legislation was carried out smoothly. More enterprises joined in pilot demonstration, such as Novozymes. A new awareness raising plan was prepared. Training program was designed to different audiences such as officials, communities, media and general public.
Pilot demonstrations made achievements on trainings, subnational legislation and ABS agreements. In Yunnan the first version of the “Administrative Measures on Access and Benefit Sharing of Genetic Resources and Related Traditional Knowledge in Xishuangbanna Dai Autonomous Prefecture” was completed. Formal ABS agreement was signed. In Guangxi prefecture level project management office established. Measures for the Administration of Access and Benefit-sharing of Biological Genetic Resources and Related Traditional Knowledge in Guangxi (Draft) was posted on web for public comments. Six ABS agreements between local communities and enterprises was promoted. In Hunan, the Biodiversity Conservation Regulation of Xiangxi Tujia and Miao Autonomous Prefecture, which ABS rules are adopted, was reviewed by the Prefecture Peoples Congress in October for the first time. The legislation of ABS in China made progress. The Regulation on Management of Benefit-sharing from Using Biological Genetic Resources (draft) was further prepared, by the national leading group for ABS legislation, and circulated among national authorities for their comments and suggestions. This project is providing support to experts in national ABS legislation committee reviewing comments collected and making revision according to these comments.
The total expenditure this year is $705,470.57, the delivery rate was 50%.
